Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Well, I should go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. I'll tell everybody here that you say hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, don't. I'm mad at them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not one of them called to congratulate me on our engagement.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah. That... they might be off the hook for because I... didn't tell them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just didn't, you know, want a deal.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on, it won't be that bad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. You know what? Here we go. [stands up] Uh, everybody? I just want to make an announcement. Pam and I are engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [speakerphone] Hi everyone!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I thought you were already engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That was Roy. She was engaged to Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I got a gift for Pam and Roy. Do I have to get another one?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A little close to my engagement there Tuna, what's your game here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: To get married.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [raises hand] She's not a virgin, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walking in] What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, nothing. Nothing Michael! Just saying hi. [Michael waves "hi" at the phone]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: The tall guy got engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Jim] To be married?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. [Michael hugs/tackles Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Pencils down! [Dwight quickly puts his pencil down] Just kidding, take your time.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Today is ethics day. After they finish their quiz I'm going to run my first ethics meeting here. It's gonna be insaaaaane. No, it's not. I have to read from the binder.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [trying to assist Michael, who is trying to press play on a CD player] I got it, I got it. [Olivia Newton-John's "Let's Get Physical" starts to play as Holly and Michael jog into the meeting room, dancing]

Quote.Speaker: Michael & Holly
Quote.Text: Let's get ethical! Ethical! I wanna get ethical! Let's get into Ethics yeah! Let me hear that Dunder Mifflin talk! Your body talk. Let me hear your body talk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: WOO! Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "Why are you helping her? You're not even dating." She's my friend... and... ultimately my strategy is to merge this into a relationship... without her even knowing. Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, let's give it for Miss... Holly Flaaaax! [everyone claps]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Thanks Michael. [Michael groans exhaustingly] Today we're going to have a business ethics seminar because recently, without mentioning any names, there has been some misconduct at corporate and we have a very strict ethics policy and that employee has been fired.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh come on! He's right there. [points at Ryan] He was hired. [to Jim] Oh check it out, "Hired Guy."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. [they bump fists]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ok, elephant in the room. Let's talk about it. Do I regret what I did? Of course I do. Even though it was an amazing ride, and I'll give you an example. Anyone see Survivor season six? [Dwight raises his hand] Anyone know Joanna on that show? [Dwight nods] In New York City, I hooked up with a girl who looked exactly like that. Indistinguishable. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clapping] Ok. Well done. Good speech Ryan, you're a good guy.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Let's start discussing those questionnaires that you filled in this morning. It is wrong to make personal calls during work hours. Now, some of you marked that you very strongly agree. But ideally you would have selected totally agree.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I thought very strongly agree sounded stronger than totally agree.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Corporate would like to emphasize that ideally you would all totally agree with that statement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I think we can all totally agree that Holly is totally fantastic. [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Thank you. In fact, spending a half hour at the water cooler during work hours is a form of stealing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yes, it's called time theft, and it's the same as taking money from the company. Can anyone think of examples of things that are over the line time wasters?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey-oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Holly] Can't set 'em up like that.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why is ok for smokers to take breaks all the time? If I want to go outside and hang out once an hour, then I'll just take up smoking. I'll do it. I don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'll smoke with you. I got a bag of cigars in my purse.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Stealing office supplies is another big ethical area that there seems to be some confusion about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can we have a moment? [whispering] Can I talk to you for a sec? Lot of good stuff. And you look... you look fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Dight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What should we be working on while you guys are talking?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do some... do some work. [whispering to Holly] People expect a lot from these meetings. Laughter, sudden twists. Surprise endings. You need to be Robin Williams and M. Night Shyamalan. You need to be Robin Shyamalan.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well, I just have to get through the binder.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you... just... you're kind of losing them.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I am?

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: Yeah, don't think about the stakes. It'll freak you out.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ok. [to everyone] Michael makes a really good point so, uh, let's just open this up a little bit. Say my name is Lauren and here I am shopping in a supermarket and I steal a pencil. That's not right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [coughs to hide his words] Lauren, [coughs] enough with the pencils.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, I have to go over pencils and office supplies. It's part of the ethics thing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That isn't ethics. Ethics is a real discussion of the competing conceptions of the good. This is just the corporate anti-shoplifting rules.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll drop an ethics bomb on you. Would you steal bread to feed your family? ... Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Exactly, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I took intro to philosophy, twice. No big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a trick question. The bread is poisoned. Also, it's not your real family. You've been cuckolded by a stronger, smarter male.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No that's... not how it works.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would not... steal the bread. And I would not let my family go hungry.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ok, but we should get back to business. Have any of you ever faced any ethical dilemmas in the workplace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anybody? This is a chance for you to say something without any repercussions. Stanley? Oscar, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pass.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will go first. When I discovered YouTube I didn't work for five days. I did nothing. I viewed Cookie Monster sings Chocolate Rain about a thousand times.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What was the dilemma?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To tell you or not. And I'm glad I did. I feel very very good. Cathartic. I promise you that you are not going to get into trouble. You can say anything you want with total and complete immunity.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh-- no no no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, [interrupting gibberish]. Come on, anybody. Let it fly.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ok, once in a while I'll take a long lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A siesta!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Time thief. Time thief! Fire him!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, you've really never stolen any company time?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Never!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are a thief of joy. Anybody else. Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sometimes I download pirated music onto my work computer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who hasn't? Good. Good! What else?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No-- I, I'd like to hear more about that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I once reported Oscar to the INS. Turns out he's clean, but I'm glad I did it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, let's keep this party movin' on.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'll go. Have you guys ever met Bruce Meyers, the Scranton rep for Hammermill?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bruuuuuuuuuce.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Well for the past six years I have been sleeping with him in exchange for discounts on our supplies and Outback Steakhouse gift certificates.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Jackpot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ach! Wuh--

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Meredith, that is serious. I mean not only that a conflict of interests, there's also an exchange of goods.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Exchange of steak. Have you ever had sirloin steak, honey?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's crazy. That's crazy talk! Meredith! The Merenator, sleepin' with suppliers! Hoo-ooh! Wow! What time we got? [checks watch] You know what? That's a good place to end it. Right there. This, I think, was a great ethics seminar. She has given us a lot of wonderful things to think about. Right... what is wrong. Who's to say? Really. In the end. I mean because it is... unknowable. But, let's give her a round of applause. Holly, everybody. Holly! Get back to work. [everyone applauds, then leaves] [to Holly] Great job. I am truly impressed. That, uh, you really pulled that one out. Classic. Classic meeting. We should celebrate.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael, there is some serious issues with Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I mean all of you have done things I wouldn't have done myself but Meredith's actions are really over the line.

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: Nnyeah. What ya gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So, regarding this supplier, approximately how many liaisons have there been?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Liaisons, you mean meet-ups? I don't know, once a month for six years. Something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meredith, why don't you tell Holly... it's not what she thinks. Nothing unethical happened... and that you just like to sleep around.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Am I in trouble here or something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... no, this is just a stupid formality.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, it's not a formality. Now, were these, um, meet-ups just personal? Unrelated to business?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nah, I wouldn't have done it if it wasn't for the discount paper. There's not a lot of fruit in those looms.

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: Ughh! For the love of God we're trying to help you... stupid bag.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What I don't understand is... why the steak coupons? I mean, if you were already getting the discounted paper?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Well it's funny. Maybe it's a girl thing, but after we did it, and he would give me those coupons, I just felt good about myself. [Holly begins to write in her notebook] Hey what's going on here? I thought I had immunity?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well unfortunately immunity or something being off the record does not really exist in the workplace. I mean I've never heard of anyone who's kept their job after something like this.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Well... I'm not quitting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [starts a stopwatch as Dwight yawns, stops it when Dwight is done] Yawn. Four seconds.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh you had said that you don't do anything personal during work time so... I'm just making sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, so wait a minute, you're going to time me every time I yawn? That's absurd. [Jim smiles and starts the stopwatch] Really? [in a mocking voice] Oh hey look, monkey knows how to use a stopwatch everybody! He's ti-- [Dwight conceeds and goes back to work, Jim stops the watch]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Personal conversation. Seventeen seconds.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is no way that that was-- [Jim starts the watch]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [stops the watch] One second.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, well. Holly... lujah! It's a miracle, you're at your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: It's Mike-raculous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hoo-ooh! Reaching! You'll get there. Anyway, I was giving it some thought, and there's no reason that two attractive, good looking, intelligent, funny, attractive people can't, you know, just... sit down and work this whole Meredith thing out.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Sounds good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Would you care to bang it out over lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh I already bought this...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh no, no, no. Your food is no good here, my lady. [sweeps her food into the trash can, misses] Sorry! You know what? Let's go out! Dunder Mifflin's treat. Um, actually you're not a client... so... we'll just split it? Ethical.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So, I've gone over corporate policy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you think? What do you think of this place?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, it's very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Istn't it? Yeah, it's kind of... business/romantic. So you're from Des Moines?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, that sounds so... warm.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: In Summer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here too. You know what my favorite season is?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Maybe we should talk about Meredith first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, get the boring stuff out of the way. Autumn was what I was going to say. When the leaves change. It's just, I... I think it is the most contemplative of seasons.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ok, so I have gone over this and I have thought about it and I just don't think there is any way I can write a report that doesn't end with her being terminated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, terminator, terminator.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm from da future.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: By any chance, did you see Battlestar Galactica last night?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I did not. Was that any good?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually not. It was really so-so.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. [Dwight turns around, but Jim holds up the stopwatch, threatening to start it]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean I like all the crazy monsters and stuff. You know, like klingons and wookies and all that but... [Dwight begins to turn around again, Jim holds up the watch] Sorry, was there something you wanted to add, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is that anything like the original Battlestar Galactica?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, it's weird. It's practically a shot for shot remake.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really? [Dwight closes his eyes, clutches the paper in his hands] Huh, that's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Story's kinda bland. It's about this guy named Dumbledore Calrissian who needs to return the ring back to Mordor.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really? That doesn't sound right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just don't want my employees thinking that their jobs depend on performance. I mean, what sort of place is that to call home? And Meredith needs this job. This is her main source of money.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well, that's very sweet but we have to follow the protocol. Those are the rules.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, new idea. We don't report it at all. We just punish her.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: We punish her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm, tell her she can't have sex for six months.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I don't think we could enforce that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. I saw this thing, like a belt with a key.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: A chastity belt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's more of a underwear garment that has little spikes like made of, sometimes they are made of metal. You know what I am talking about. You unlock a little door that... down... where you, where you put, where you put the...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He has not stopped working for a second. At 12:45 he sneezed while keeping his eyes open, which I always thought was impossible. At 1:32 he peed, and I know that because he did it in an open soda bottle under the desk while filling out expense reports. And on the flip side, I have been so busy watching him that I haven't even started work. It's exhausting, being this vigilant. I'll probably have to go home early today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am just saying that I don't think that you understand what I am saying.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, you are saying that we should sweep it under the carpet, accept the discount on supplies, not fire Meredith and pretend like the whole thing never happened.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What am I saying?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... bleh busted. I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm saying that her behavior is unethical and a little icky and I don't think I want to work in an environment where that sort of conduct is tolerated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you have to tolerate a lot when you are part of a family.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: It's not a family. It's a workplace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will be honest with you. That car ride did not go well and that was not my fault. The only reason I am standing out here right now is because I don't want to take the elevator with her. And I am holding on to her leftovers. [throws Holly's leftovers in the trash]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Dwight walks back to his desk] 19 minutes and 48 seconds. What were we doing for 19 minutes and 48 seconds?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: None of your business.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So I guess I can assume that was personal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight stares at Angela, buttoning the top button of her blouse] Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So maybe you're not completely ethical after all.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, maybe I'm not. [Dwight grins and gives a sly look at the camera]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: It's been a little tense. People are suspicious of me. And my best friend in the office won't even talk to me. Turns out being the morality police does not make you popular. I should know because in middle school I was the hall monitor and the kids used to stuff egg salad in my locker. I was just hoping middle school was over.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kendall from corporate HR is on line one and Holly is on her way in too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's the only thing worse than one HR rep?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Two HR reps.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You get me.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Can I sit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. Can you? Kendall, my main man.

Quote.Speaker: Kendall
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Listen, Holly, Michael, I just got the report that your branch submitted and there's a lot of stuff about a relationship Meredith is having with..

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yes, that came out during the ethics seminar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let the record show that it was during the immunity part of the seminar.

Quote.Speaker: Kendall
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not sure these circumstances warrant any action.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I think it is pretty clear that it was unethical.

Quote.Speaker: Kendall
Quote.Text: Well, from what I can gather it seems like a gray area. Look, to be honest the company is getting a discount at a tough time in our balance sheet and I don't know that the right thing to do for the company is to turn our noses up at that.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Umm, Kendall, I understand that the discount is good for the company but I'm just not happy about the way we are getting it.

Quote.Speaker: Kendall
Quote.Text: I thought it was clear with you, Holly. Your task was to get signatures from the employees showing that they completed the training.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, I understand.

Quote.Speaker: Kendall
Quote.Text: Every other branch has managed to get this to us so if it's not something you can handle then that's a different discussion.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No. I can do it.

Quote.Speaker: Kendall
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do you tell somebody that you care about deeply, "I told you so." Gently with a rose? In a funny way, like it's a hilarious joke? Or do you just let it go, because saying it would just make things worse? ... Probably the funny way.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Can I have everyone's attention? Excuse me, may I have everyone's attention, please. We need to finish the ethics seminar.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No way, lady.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's a trap.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Everyone, please, I just need your signatures to show corporate that I gave you the training.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Don't sign anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, everybody listen up. If you are not in that conference room in two minutes I am going to kill you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's a quarter to five and I have started to gather my things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get in there right now or I'm gonna lose it! [everyone gets up to go in the conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Am I getting fired?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now is really not the time, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: In this next section we examine the difference between sick days and personal days. Sick days are only to be used when an illness precludes you form doing your job or can spread to your coworkers. Personal days, on the other hand, are much more flexible.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thank you, Meredith, this was delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, where is the steak sauce?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think we're out.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I got some in my minivan somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wait a second, how does the steak factor in again?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think she got it as a tip, but I don't know why she didn't just take cash.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't care what she's doing. I just hope she keeps doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Amen. Just keep the ribs coming.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Stealing office supplies is another big ethical area that there seems to be some confusion about.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's a big ethical area?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Listen, I would love to have an honest conversation with management about ethics. Why isn't the company doing better? Mmm... it could be the pad of Post-its I took home last week. Or it could be the twelve million dollars in deferred compensation in stock options they paid the CEO for a year of substandard performance. I'm sure we'll cover both in the seminar.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I've done some things I'm not proud of. Committed some atrocities in Vietnam, uh, two years ago. Princess Cruise Lines.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: During our honeymoon safari in Africa, Bob and I were driving late at night, and he'd been drinking, and suddenly thump. We hit something with our jeep. It was probably a man. We didn't know what to do. We heard the police were corrupt and they might beat us, so we just kept driving as fast as we could. We bribed the airline, got on a plane that night, and fled home. Maybe it was just an ostrich. In a soccer uniform.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Have any of you ever faced any ethical dilemmas in the work place?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's keep this rollin'... Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, but you mean other than embezzling?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fraud, Jim, Fraud.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fraud.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Sure, last year you guys were riding me really hard for the website and I just peeled out my Z3 and I knocked the mirror off somebody's car. I never said a thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You knocked the mirror off of my car.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, isn't that messed up?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That guy did a lot of things I'm not proud of.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, when you say "that guy", you mean you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I mean the guy I used to be. I'm Ryan 2.0 and if it makes you feel any better, that guy did a lot of messed up stuff to me too. [tries to walk away]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, you mean that you did a lot of messed up stuff to you... too?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look, I feel you okay? That guy took no responsibility for his actions.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But are, are you gonna pay for my mirror?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: If I have to answer for everything that guy did... [shakes head] I'm never gonna move on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It was like two hundred dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We're never going to get what need from that guy. [still shaking head, pats Kevin on the shoulder and walks out of the kitchen]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, anybody see a pair of sunglasses?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Umm... I think I saw some in the kitchen. [toaster oven bell rings, Ryan opens it as smoke rolls out and he see's his melted sunglasses on the tray, Ryan takes cooked sunglasses to Kevin] Oh! I didn't do that. That was Kevin 1.0, but he hurt a lot of people Ryan, and I can't accept responsibility for what he did. [Ryan walks away and throws his sunglasses in the trash, Kevin smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What are we gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: About what?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Holly. She's on the warpath. She is gunning for all our jobs. Do you guys have any dirt on her?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mmm... sometimes her stockings have a run in them.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No. Something I can blackmail her with.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: One time I said good morning to her, and she didn't say it back.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Stanley, didn't she say a bunch of racist stuff to you?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No, that was you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You weren't even in the room! Thanks for nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, how did it go?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, cr..., oh, God. Meredith, you know what? I just need a minute, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Okay. [remains sitting]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you need?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm getting fired, aren't I? I can't get fired. I got nothing else. Nothing. No skill set. Can't type, bad on the phone, not great with people.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... really want to keep you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Where else am I gonna get another job that lets me come it at eleven and leave at four?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I wish Toby was still here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nnnngah!
